content.description: A delicate face crux leads to a 5.10A hand crack.  This route faces southwest.

This route ascends the slab on the backside (or rappel line) of Lucas Palucas.  Its ascends a low angle slab.  This is a safe sport slab climb which would be appropriate for a timid or new leader or for someones first lead climb.
content.protection: Five bolts to a bolted anchor.
content.location: Located in the corridor just west of Brit corridor  (and as you hike over to Cling or Fling Corridor).  The climb faces north.

content.description: This is the crack climb on a boulder just So. of Butt Nugget 2000. It has one bolt and a rap anchor.
content.protection: med gear and one QD for a bolt. Anchor on top.
content.location: Near the Brit Corridor and facing the pointed formation with The Butt Nugget 2000.

climbs.name: Lucas Palucas
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Cyndie Bransford, and Christie, January 1994

content.description: This is a fun face climb, with knobs and smearing on very coarse-grained rock.  This route is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.
content.location: Outside Brit Corridor to the west.

content.description: This is a fun well protected route. Vertical face climbing up a beautiful quartz dike leads past 4 bolts. A reach around to the right and a short crack to the top. It is just outside the east end of the Cling or Fling Corridor or the upper end of the Brits in Drag Corridor.
content.protection: In addition to the 4 bolts you need one mid sized cam (2") for pro at the top and runners for the anchor.

climbs.name: Like it or Lump it
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Tom Burke

content.description: Up a wide crack (past a big black knob), up a crack/ramp, to 2 bolts on a steep face. The formation. (The Lump, is on the right as you approach Isles in the Sky. (Rubicon is to the Left). It is the obvious formation with the "window" as seen from the parking lot. 2 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. This formation is just past the Brit Corridor
content.protection: Some trad gear (small to large) and QDs for the bolts to the top.  Anchor on top.
content.location: Just past the Brit Corridor. Easily seen from the Parking lot, and you walk right past it as you hike towards Isles in the Sky.

climbs.name: Cottonball
climbs.fa: (TR)  Mike Cummings, Todd Gordon, Michelle Watkins    FA  (Lead)  Mike Cummings, Lizz Hill, Reece Bynum, Chris Archer, Justin Binder

content.description: This route is located at the entrance to the Brit Corridor, on the left.Â  It is on the same wall as Brits in Drag. Start with a difficult mantle, then easier climb up scoops to a difficult thin finish.
content.protection: Four bolts to a bolted rap anchor.
content.location: Left side of Brit Corridor Entrance.

content.description: This route climbs the east face of the pointed spire just at the entrance to the Brit Corridor (right side).  The climbing is fun, traversing up a right slanting rail which clipping bolts.  The finish is tricky and goes up to the left. The rock is " less than perfect" on this climb, but the climbing is fun enough.
content.protection: Climb up past 4 bolts and 1 fixed pin to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Right side of the entrance to the Brit Corridor.

climbs.name: Brits In Drag
climbs.fa: Brian Courtney, Dave Evans, and Todd Gordon 1981

content.description: This climb has a nice mixture of steep hand jams, liebacks, flared hand jams, and thin face climbing.  It is best done in two pitches to reduce rope drag.  It faces northeast, and is therefore shady most of the time.
content.protection: one bolt on each pitch, plus a bolted belay - bring a standard rack as well
